title: Jennings strikes Moehrig after earlier 'cheap shot'
content: 49ers wide receiver Jauan Jennings responded to a "cheap shot" from Tre'von Moehrig by throwing an open-handed right cross to the Panthers safety's face after the final whistle Monday night.

title: Sources: Bucs get good news on Mayfield's MRI
content: The MRI for Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield revealed a low-grade AC joint sprain in his left shoulder but showed no additional damage, sources told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler on Monday.

title: Pistons tie '90, '04 title teams, win 13th in row
content: Guard Cade Cunningham and the surging Detroit Pistons, who set an NBA record for consecutive losses in a single NBA season with 28 in 2023, tied a franchise record Monday night with their 13th straight victory, defeating the Indiana Pacers 122-117.

title: Attorneys: LSU saga hindering Kelly job candidacy
content: Attorneys for Brian Kelly have informed LSU in a letter that the school's claim that it had not "formally terminated" Kelly as its football coach has "made it nearly impossible" for Kelly to get another coaching job.

title: Herro keeps red-hot Heat rolling in season debut
content: Tyler Herro eventually got going in his return from ankle surgery in September and led Miami to a win over Dallas on Monday night.

title: Dodgers star Ohtani to play for Japan in WBC
content: Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani will play for Team Japan in the 2026 World Baseball Classic as the country looks to defend their 2023 title.

title: Chase sorry for spitting: 'What I did was wrong'
content: Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase apologized Monday for spitting on Steelers defensive back Jalen Ramsey.

title: Minority owners claim Ishbia mismanaging Suns
content: A pair of Phoenix Suns minority owners allege that Mat Ishbia is using the franchise as "his personal piggy bank" in a lawsuit claiming misconduct and mismanagement by the Suns' governor.

title: Three Week 12 comeback wins and what they mean: Barnwell on the Cowboys, Chiefs, Lions
content: Dallas was down 21. Detroit was down 10. And Kansas City was down 11. What did we learn as all three rallied in the second half to win their games on Sunday?

title: Wetzel: Lane Kiffin has a near $100 million decision coming Saturday. He better win Friday
content: As the drama at Ole Miss drags on, there's a game to play Friday. And the pressure on Kiffin to win will be overwhelming.

title: What to know about Damon Jones, the man at the center of two NBA scandals
content: After making more than $21 million across 11 seasons in the NBA, the NBA journeyman fell hard -- and, prosecutors allege, into a life of crime.

title: Surprise signings! Potential busts! We hand out 2025-26 MLB free agent superlatives
content: Surprise signings? Slugger or bust? Most impact? We've got a yearbook's worth of awards for the top MLB free agents.

content: Our insiders answer one big question on the top NBA teams with title ambitions and explain what they need to do to stay a contender.

content: Let's take the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, and more first-month standout storylines.

title: WNBA mock draft: UConn's Fudd is new No. 1 as Wings win lottery
content: Azzi Fudd is the new projected No. 1 pick after Dallas won the draft lottery for the second consecutive year.

title: Predicting the USMNT's starting lineup at the World Cup: What previous tournaments tell us
content: When the USMNT plays in a World Cup, there are always some locks, and always some players who come out of nowhere to start games.

title: Ranking Ronaldo's overhead kick goals for Real Madrid, Portugal, Al Nassr
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's 954th career goal was one of his best, adding to his collection of stunning acrobatic strikes. Here they all are -- ranked!

title: Will Man United ever change? Another missed chance under Amorim on dismal night vs. Everton
content: Exactly one year after Ruben Amorim's arrival, Manchester United had their latest chance to prove they had turned a corner. They couldn't.

title: Liverpool's crisis deepens with another defeat, and more dropped points for Madrid
content: A bad season just keeps getting worse for Arne Slot and Liverpool, while Real Madrid also dropped points.

title: NFL Week 13 odds: Eagles a TD favorite over Bears, Colts have edge vs. Texans
content: It's Thanksgiving week of the NFL season. Here are the odds, spreads and totals for every Week 13 game.

title: Boys' 2026 recruiting class rankings: Michigan State up, Houston in, Duke far from finished
content: Missouri remains No. 1, with Michigan State at No. 2, Duke No. 3 and new adds Houston, Purdue, West Virginia.

content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Weekly waiver pickups: Add these defensemen for assists, power-play points
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vinícius tells Real Madrid he won't renew contract
content: Vinícius Júnior has expressed his unwillingness to renew his contract with Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Payyanur bomb attack case in Kerala: CPI(M) local body poll candidate, aide sentenced to 20 years
content: Taliparamba Additional District Sessions Judge awards imprisonment of 20 years and fine of ₹2.5 lakh each to convicts V.K. Nishad and T.C.V. Nandakumar. They will effectively serve 10 years in jail

title: SIR-induced 'reverse migration' to Bangladesh: Bengal Governor takes train to reach Murshidabad
content: C.V. Ananda Bose had on Monday (November 24, 2025) visited the Hakimpur border outpost in North 24 Parganas district and interacted with local people to take a first-hand stock of the ground situation

title: Gram panchayat employees stage protest in Kalaburagi over unpaid salary
content: They urged district authorities to resolve long-pending service issues affecting bill collectors, others

title: Ambedkar, Constitution subjected to 'ferocious assault' by RSS: Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh recalled that in his closing speech before moving the resolution, Ambedkar had hailed the role of the Congress in drafting the Constitution

title: RSS must realise that permissions come from constitutional provisions, not from shouting Jai Shri Ram, says Dalit Sangharsha Samiti
content: For the first time in its 100-year history, the RSS had to follow the Constitution and the law when its route march was allowed in Chittapur on November 16, 2025, as per court directions

title: Lack of transparency, law and order issues will cost DMK in 2026: G.K. Vasan
content: People of Tamil Nadu feel that treating the Union government as an enemy does not help the State in any way, the  Tamil Maanila Congress (Moopanar) leader said.

title: PM Modi holds roadshow to Ram temple ahead of flag ceremony
content: Many held the tricolour while some had the BJP’s flag bearing the lotus symbol as the Prime Minister’s convoy moved past them amid heavy security deployment

title: Ambulance driver 'abandons' mother, newborn in Palghar; probe ordered
content: “On November 24, while being transported home after discharge, the ambulance driver allegedly halted the vehicle 2km before her village in Mokhada taluka, and left her behind,” say officials

title: Volcanic ash from Ethiopia forces flight cancellations in Hyderabad, RGIA urges travellers to check latest flight status
content: The Hyderabad airport stated that some flights may experience delays or cancellations depending on evolving conditions

title: Madhampatty Pakashala case: Madras HC refuses to restrain Joy Crizildaa from using the brand’s hashtag on social media
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar dismissed the interim injunction application filed by Madhampatty Thangavelu Hospitality Private Limited

title: Assam Assembly winter session: Adjournment motion allowed to discuss Zubeen’s death
content: The Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said the government is also equally seized of the matter and requested the Speaker to allow the adjournment motion

title: Shalibanda electronics showroom fire: One killed, eight injured; officials examine explosion and car crash angles
content: A case has been registered by the Moghalpura police, and further investigation is underway to determine the exact trigger for the incident as well the identity of the deceased

title: Volcanic ash plumes: Air India cancels flights; conducts inspection of aircraft
content: Ash clouds from the recent eruption of the Hayli Gubbi volcano in Ethiopia are impacting flight operations, and there are reports suggesting that clouds are drifting towards the western parts of India

title: Ash cloud from Ethiopia volcano to clear India by 7.30 p.m.: IMD
content: Forecast models indicated ash influence over Gujarat, Delhi-NCR, Rajasthan, Punjab and Haryana on November 25, 2025, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said

title: Kerala local body polls: Kudumbashree ‘candidates’ bank on people connect to sail through
content: The intersection of involvement in the Kudumbashree network and political ambitions has become the go-to for political parties of all hues in order to pick candidates for the local body elections

title: Kerala local body polls: LDF vying for a hat-trick in traditional UDF stronghold Sulthan Bathery
content: Ruling council believes that the developmental activities undertaken over the past 10 years will trump the tradition. Feud within Congress in  Wayanad district has put  UDF in a disadvantage.  NDA is hoping for a repeat and possibly surpass its performance in the parliamentary polls of 2024, when  BJP had enough votes within the municipality to come second

title: ACB clocked 621 cases in five years but 519 await prosecution nod: Forum for Good Governance
content: Forum says prolonged pendency is weakening deterrence, emboldening corrupt officials and creating the impression that the system protects wrongdoers

title: Ayodhya Ram temple: PM Modi hoists saffron flag marking completion of construction
content: PM Modi was accompanied by RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat during the ceremony, alongside Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel and Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath

title: What does the SC’s advisory opinion imply? | Explained
content: What were the questions raised by the Presidential reference as a result of a judgment delivered in April 2025? What were the key points delivered by the Supreme Court in its opinion? Should Governors act on the aid and advice of the Council of Ministers?

title: Canada's Foreign Minister says Ottawa is working fast to advance India trade deal
content: Both countries expect to be able to double bilateral trade by 2030, and noted that Canada is India's seventh largest trade partner for goods and services

title: Ethiopia’s volcanic eruption LIVE: Air India cancels flights; conducts inspection of aircraft
content: The Hayli Gubbi volcano, located in Ethiopia’s Afar region about 800km northeast of Addis Ababa near the Eritrean border, erupted on Sunday (November 23, 2025) for several hours

title: A.P. CM tells officials to improve public service delivery by adopting technologies
content: All government departments should be connected to the Data Lake for better service delivery and data-based decisions, says CM Naidu

title: Kerala Local body polls 2025: SEC faces demand for postal ballots ahead of elections
content: Unlike the Assembly and Lok Sabha polls, local body polls do not have a provision for postal ballots; Postal ballots are restricted to officials on election duty

title: New TB vaccine for adolescents, adults ready for commercialisation
content: Developed jointly by Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bhubaneswar and the Institute of Life Sciences (ILS), Bhubaneswar, the vaccine will help combat mycobacterium tuberculosis

title: West Bengal CEO meets telecom service providers over internet connectivity issues among BLOs
content: This comes in the wake of a section of BLOs raising concerns around the unavailability of high-speed internet necessary for the digitisation process of enumeration forms

title: Congress alleges deletion of voters’ names during SIR in Rajasthan
content: Pradesh Congress Committee president Govind Singh Dotasra said the voters with Congress ideology were being removed from electoral rolls on the pretext of their absence

title: Bengal Governor visits Swarupnagar to take stock of ‘reverse migration’ due to SIR fears
content: Governor C. V Ananda Bose said that there are reports of exodus of people from the India- Bangladesh border and there are several interpretations of that

title: MBBS list row: Admissions should be based on merit, not religion, says J&K CM
content: CM Omar Abdullah stated that the narrative being floated around admissions at the Mata Vaishno Devi University was an attempt to “move away from constitutional principles”

title: BJP flags ‘threats’ to officials conducting SIR in West Bengal, Jharkhand
content: BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi stated that Jharkhand Minister allegedly said that any booth-level officer of the Election Commission who comes to gather information from people “should be taken hostage”

title: ISRO offers satellite support to Railways to boost communication systems
content: We will be tripling our number of satellites, including three more navigation and communication satellites, adding to the existing four, says ISRO chairman

title: Gujarat police complete verification of 31,834 people booked for ‘anti-national’ activities
content: In the verification that followed, 11,880 were found to be living at the addresses listed in the case files, while 2,326 had died

title: Amid concerns over ongoing SIR in West Bengal, some Matuas go on fast, others seek citizenship under CAA
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will visit Thakurnagar, the spiritual headquarters of the Matua community in Bongaon subdivision of North 24 Parganas district bordering Bangladesh, on Tuesday and take out a 3-km roadshow

title: Chhattisgarh school girl ends her life after accusing principal of sexual harassment
content: She has left a note in which she has mentioned the term “bad touch” and that she was sexually assaulted by the school principal nearly a week ago, say police

title: Chhattisgarh government tasks school principals to monitor stray dogs in and around premises
content: Slamming the move, Congress spokesperson Sushil Anand Shukla asked why teachers were being assigned duties meant for municipal experts

title: Karnataka moves to expand disability rights with new job and education quotas in private sector
content: A draft of the Karnataka Rights of Persons with Disabilities in Employment and Education Bill, 2025, proposing 5% reservation for persons with disabilities in all private establishments with 20 or more employees, has been released

title: One year on, Sambhal stays peaceful amid tight security
content: Police teams, 19 Magistrates, units of the Rapid Action Force and two battalions of the Provincial Armed Constabulary were deployed in the district to maintain order, said a senior officer

title: Three students from Kerala arrested for assaulting Bengaluru private firm employee over parking row
content: The trio had planned a trip and booked a Zoomcar. When they arrived in the neighbourhood to pick up the vehicle, the victim Azar Ahmed noticed the unfamiliar faces and questioned them about their presence.

title: Unable to implement CAA, BJP is creating national register of citizens through SIR: Thirumavalavan
content: According to Mr. Thirumavalavan BJP is unable to make inroads into Tamil Nadu because of DMK, VCK, and Communists.

title: Inter-State racket in fake GST invoicing busted in Chennai
content: GST Commissioner (North) said the prime suspect who was operating an unregistered tax consultancy firm, M/s A.S. Associates, in Chennai, was arrested.

title: Goa government does a U-turn on tiger presence in State
content: The State, which claimed in 2018 that there is no “permanent presence” of tigers, has stated the opposite in the Mahadayi sharing dispute issue before Supreme Court

title: Woman from Arunachal Pradesh stopped at China airport; India issues strong demarche
content: Prema Thongdok said immigration and airlines staff were “unprofessional and rude”, they laughed and mocked calling Arunachal Pradesh a Chinese territory

title: SBI Ventures plans to launch ₹2,000-crore climate-focussed fund in Jan-Mar
content: It will help unlock green growth, a new financial opportunity, SBI Ventures Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer Prem Prabhakar said

title: ‘Sankranti Sambaralu’ to be organised in NTR District during harvest festival
content: Andhra Taxi App to be launched, temples, tourist spots to be developed for the festival, says Collector

title: Supreme Court notice to government on plea to frame national compensation policy for unjust imprisonment
content: Petition seeks to recommend appropriate yardsticks for monetary and non-monetary relief, including counselling, livelihood assistance, and social reintegration

title: Modi to visit Ayodhya, hoist sacred flag at Ram Temple
content: The Dhwaja Rohan (flag-hoisting) ceremony signifies the completion of the Ram Temple’s construction; The event is taking place on the auspicious day of Vivaah Panchami.

title: West Bengal CM writes to CEC asking whether initiatives taken are at the behest of a political party
content: This is the second letter addressed by the Trinamool Congress chairperson to CEC; in her letter dated November 20, Ms. Banerjee had urged CEC Gyanesh Kumar to halt the SIR pointing out that the human cost of the management of the exercise has turned unbearable

title: Protests in M.P.’s Raisen over rape of 6-year-old girl; accused remains absconding
content: The girl was taken to a government hospital in neighbouring Obaidullaganj but was immediately referred to AIIMS, Bhopal where she is undergoing treatment

title: Navy gets its ‘silent hunter’, 80% home-grown INS Mahe
content: Army chief General Dwivedi launches warship, says in age of ‘multi-domain’ warfare, ‘true strength’ of the armed forces lies in ‘synergy’, adds that Army, Navy and Air Force form “the trinity of India’s strategic strength”

title: Maoists offer to surrender by February 15 in letter to three CMs
content: Special zonal committee of the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist) asks Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh to pause security operations as it considers the government’s rehabilitation programme

title: Press Club concerned over some clauses of Data Protection Act
content: They flagged serious lacunae in the DPDP Act, 2023, that impinge upon press freedom and directly hit Article 19 (1)

title: BEL, Safran sign JV to manufacture precision-guided weapon
content: The agreement was signed in New Delhi by BEL CMD Manoj Jain and SED Executive Vice President Alexandre Ziegler. Secretary (Defence Production) Sanjeev Kumar and Safran CEO Olivier Andries were present for the ceremony

title: Man posing as PMO official and ‘adopted son of Amit Shah’ cheats Bengaluru doctor of ₹2.7 crore
content: According to the police, Sujayendra convinced the doctor that he would help establish a ‘villa-style premium ayurvedic hospital’ and took a total of ₹2.7 crore under various pretexts

title: HC sets aside order resuming nine acres land allotted to AAI
content: The order seeking resumption of the nine acres of land at Kancha Gachhibowli was ‘bereft of reasons’ and lacked jurisdiction

title: Rebel threat to UDF, LDF in Kozhikode
content: Attempts to quell the rebel menace and passify dissident candidates to back down came to an end at sundown on November 24, the last day for withdrawal of nominations.

title: Elephant safaris resume in Corbett and Rajaji reserves after 7 years
content: Elephant safaris have been resumed in the Dhikala and Jhirna ranges of the Corbett Tiger Reserve (CTR) and the Cheela range of the Rajaji Tiger Reserve (RTR) during the current tourist season

title: Japanese delegation visits ISRO to review Chandrayaan-5/ LuPEX mission
content: The Chandrayaan-5 LuPEX mission is the fifth mission in the Chandrayaan series of lunar missions to study the lunar volatile materials, including lunar water, in the vicinity of a Permanently Shadowed Region in the lunar South pole

title: Cab drivers protest outside Uber centre in Bengaluru accusing the company of unfair practices
content: The protest, organised by members of the Bharath Transportation Group, alleged  that Uber is favouring fleet-attached vehicles over independent drivers

title: Genome Valley gets bioprocess design, scale-up facility
content: Minister Sridhar Babu, who opened the facility, said TGIIC is to undertake ₹200 crore infrastructure upgrades as the famous Life Sciences cluster of Hyderabad commemorates 25 years

title: Leadership issue in Karnataka: All eyes on Rahul Gandhi
content: Party sources say that Kharge is likely to brief Rahul Gandhi in a couple of days following which both Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar are likely to be called for consultation

title: Anaemia, malnutrition still rampant in Telangana’s Koya and Gond tribal communities
content: Recent ‘One Health’ outreach held in Bhadradri Kothagudem brings renewed attention to long-standing health inequities in some of the most remote forested regions in the State

title: ED raids three online gaming companies; freezes accounts with over ₹523 crore
content: The ED says it has found that WinZO continued operating real-money games in foreign markets such as the U.S., Brazil, and Germany, using the same platform as India- even after the nationwide ban on RMGs took effect on August 22, 2025

title: Silent for 10,000 years… then a blast: Eyewitnesses recall Ethiopia volcano eruption
content: A remote Ethiopian volcano, dormant for millennia, erupted violently, spewing ash 15km high and darkening skies.  Locals described the blast as a "bomb of smoke and ash." While no lives were lost, the eruption has severely impacted livestock-herding communities, with ash covering grazing lands and threatening livelihoods.  The event has caused widespread shock due to its unprecedented nature.

title: Ethiopia’s volcanic ash cloud enters Delhi: Is the city’s already ‘very poor’ air at risk? Experts weigh in
content: A volcanic ash cloud from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi volcano entered western India on Monday evening, moving across northern states.  While unlikely to significantly impact Delhi's air quality, the plume is traveling at high altitudes and could disrupt air traffic, causing delays. Authorities and airlines are closely monitoring the situation for safe air travel.

title: ‘Sun, Om & tree’: What symbols on Ayodhya Ram Temple’s 'Dharma Dhwaj' signify
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived in Ayodhya to hoist the specially crafted "Dharma Dhwaj" atop the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Temple. This significant event, scheduled for Vivah Panchami during the auspicious Abhijit Muhurat, symbolizes the culmination of a centuries-old aspiration and a moment of immense cultural pride. The flag, engineered for durability, bears sacred symbols representing core Sanatan Dharma values.

title: Genesis mission: Trump's new plan to beat China in AI race; explained
content: President Trump has launched the "Genesis Mission," a major federal initiative to counter China's AI advancements. This ambitious program aims to create a powerful scientific platform by integrating vast government data, accelerating breakthroughs in energy, medicine, and national security.  The Department of Energy will lead the effort, leveraging national labs and private partnerships to develop AI models that could drastically reduce research timelines, ensuring American technological superiority in critical fields.

title: Ethiopian volcanic eruption: How long will the ash cloud linger over India; where is it heading next?
content: Ash clouds from an Ethiopian volcanic eruption are clearing Indian skies by Tuesday evening, having drifted across northwest India since Monday. The plume, originating from the Hayli Gubbi volcano, moved across the Red Sea and Arabian Sea before impacting Gujarat, Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Delhi-NCR, Haryana, and Punjab, briefly affecting flight operations.

title: What do new labour codes mean for you? Minimum wages, gratuity to layoff rules
content: India's new labour codes, effective November 21, 2025, consolidate 29 laws, promising universal minimum wages, enhanced social security for gig workers, and improved safety. While offering businesses flexibility, they also introduce new classifications for employees and workers, impacting benefits and contract labour.  Employers must adapt HR and payroll to these significant changes.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are gold prices headed in the coming days?
content: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are poised for fluctuations, heavily influenced by the US Federal Reserve's potential rate cut in December. Geopolitical tensions also provide support. Analysts anticipate gold to trade within a range, with strong US economic data potentially leading to a correction. Silver is also expected to follow a similar pattern, reacting to Fed rate cut probabilities.

title: Gemini 3.0 launch: Salesforce CEO says won't use ChatGPT again; praises Google’s AI model
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff declared he's switching from ChatGPT to Google's Gemini 3.0 after a two-hour trial, citing significant improvements in reasoning, speed, image, and video processing. This endorsement highlights the intense competition in the AI landscape, with even OpenAI's CEO acknowledging Google's advancements.

title: 'Most confused team ever': Ex-India pacer slams Gautam Gambhir's team management
content: India's perplexing team selection, particularly at the No. 3 position, has drawn criticism during the ongoing Test series against South Africa.  Despite experimenting with different players, the management's choices have been questioned, leading to a confused batting order.  On the field, India struggled significantly, facing a large first-innings deficit.

title: International Emmy Awards 2025: Rivals wins Best Drama, Ludwig takes Best Comedy
content: The International Emmy Awards 2025 celebrated global television excellence, with the United Kingdom leading the wins with seven awards. 'Rivals' secured Best Drama, while 'Ludwig' took home Best Comedy. Spain and Japan were among other nations recognized for their outstanding productions and performances at the prestigious New York ceremony.

title: Apple's warning to stores: Foreign SIM = penalty; store closure risk
content: Apple distributors are warning Indian retailers against activating new iPhones, especially the iPhone 17 series, with foreign SIMs within 90 days, citing hefty penalties and store code blocking. This crackdown follows a surge in iPhone 17 models being diverted to high-margin markets like Russia, Africa, and the Middle East, causing domestic shortages. Retailers are pushing back against this mandate, arguing it unfairly targets them.

title: A dream beyond cinema: Dharmendra once said he ‘could’ve won an Olympic medal’
content: Legendary actor Dharmendra, known for his fitness and athletic past, passed away at 89 after a brief illness. The Sholay star, who once dreamt of representing India in sports, was admitted to Breach Candy Hospital before returning home. His demise has prompted widespread tributes from fans and sporting personalities alike.

title: Trump sent a former Miss Colorado finalist to prosecute a former FBI chief. It didn’t go well…
content: Federal law is clear: the attorney general may appoint only one interim US attorney before the role must be filled through Senate confirmation. The administration ignored that process entirely. By replacing one interim appointee with another, it bypassed the Senate, concentrated power in the hands of a loyalist, and turned a temporary exception into a revolving door.

title: How to be a value investor: Guide to finding value when the market looks pricey
content: Even with Nifty at 26,000 and Sensex at 85,000, value investing opportunities persist.  Focus on fundamentally sound businesses overlooked by the market, not fleeting trends.  Look for quality earnings, a margin of safety, and consistent profitability. Patience and discipline are key to identifying and profiting from these undervalued gems.

title: Stefon Diggs’ partner Cardi B makes gold pendant from baby’s umbilical cord
content: Cardi B commemorated her fourth child's birth by transforming her umbilical cord into a gold pendant and her placenta into vitamins. This unique practice, offered by Mommy Made Encapsulation, also includes creating a "Tree of Life" placenta print. The service aims to preserve the initial bond between parent and child, a trend embraced by other celebrities.

title: Ex-Hawks champ says Jay-Z could outscore Drake, Lil Wayne and Nicki in Verzuz
content: Former NBA star Jeff Teague ignited a hip-hop debate, boldly claiming Jay-Z could defeat Lil Wayne, Drake, and Nicki Minaj combined in a hypothetical Verzuz battle.  Teague argued Hov's extensive catalog and legacy are unparalleled, even dismissing a Roc-A-Fella vs. Young Money matchup as unfair. His strong stance reignited discussions on rap's hierarchy.

title: Taylor Swift’s Disney+ docuseries hit by Florida legal threat as Kelce stays silent
content: Taylor Swift's Disney+ docuseries faces a legal challenge from Florida artist Kimberly Marasco, who alleges copyright infringement. Marasco seeks to halt the release, claiming Swift used her poetry for lyrics and visual themes. Swift's team dismisses the claims as baseless, and legal experts deem an injunction unlikely, though the case sparks debate on creative overlap.

title: 'Multiple flights cancelled': Ethiopian volcanic ash drifts towards Himalaya — 10 things to know
content: Volcanic ash from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi eruption has disrupted airline operations across India, prompting DGCA advisories. The ash plume, carrying dangerous particles, entered Gujarat and moved eastward, forcing airlines like IndiGo and Akasa Air to cancel or divert flights. Airports are on alert for contamination, impacting flights to the Middle East and Europe.

title: 42 of 50 Muslims: J&K CM vs BJP on Vaishno Devi college admissions — what’s the row?
content: A political storm has erupted over admissions at the new Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence, with 42 out of 50 students being Muslim. Hindu groups protested, demanding admissions based on faith, while J&K CM Omar Abdullah defended the merit-based selection, emphasizing the nation's secular constitution and questioning religion-based reservations.

title: Ethiopian volcanic ash reaches India: What it is, how it travelled, and the cities impacted
content: An ash cloud from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi volcano has reached parts of India, impacting Gujarat, Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Delhi, Haryana, and Punjab. Travelling at high altitudes, the plume carries volcanic ash and sulphur dioxide, potentially darkening skies and causing flight disruptions. Aviation authorities have issued warnings, leading to some flight cancellations.

title: Mandhana's wedding postponed: Mother reveals Palash's health condition
content: Cricketer Smriti Mandhana's wedding was postponed after her father was hospitalised with heart-attack-like symptoms. Music composer Palash Muchhal, deeply attached to Smriti's father, also fell ill due to emotional stress and required hospitalisation. Doctors suspect stress triggered the father's condition amidst hectic wedding preparations. The family remains hopeful for a swift recovery and a future wedding.

title: Are banks closed today? Here’s what you need to know
content: Many in Delhi and Uttar Pradesh are confused about bank closures today, November 25th, as schools and government offices observe Guru Tegh Bahadur's martyrdom anniversary. However, banks nationwide are operating normally. The Reserve Bank of India has no scheduled holiday for this date, ensuring all banking services remain accessible to the public without interruption.

title: 'Jat Police at your service': Rajasthan remembers Dharmendra; chulha meals, Bikaner bonds live on
content: Dharmendra's deep connection to Rajasthan extended beyond his film career, encompassing loyalty and humility. As a former MP from Bikaner and co-owner of Amber Cinema, his generosity and emotional investment in relationships were legendary. His friendships, like the one with Vijay Punia, highlighted his simple nature and grace, even during his political tenure.

title: Vaughan takes dig at India’s Guwahati collapse; Jaffer fires back with Hera Pheri meme
content: Michael Vaughan playfully teased Wasim Jaffer on X after India's batting collapse against South Africa's left-arm pace.  Marco Jansen's six-wicket haul left India trailing significantly. This exchange follows Jaffer's earlier jab at Vaughan after England's Ashes defeat, with both former players sharing humorous digs over their teams' recent struggles.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex near 84,800
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Monday. While Nifty50 was below 25,950, BSE Sensex was around 84,800.

title: 'Civilian's house bombed': Pak strikes Afghan, says Taliban govt; 9 kids, 1 woman dead
content: Pakistani forces conducted strikes in Afghanistan overnight. At least ten people died, including nine children and one woman. The bombings occurred in Khost province. Air strikes in Kunar and Paktika provinces injured four civilians. This follows a suicide bombing in Peshawar. Tensions are high over terror attacks originating from Afghan territory.

title: Tornado tears through Texas’ Harris County: Drone captures ripped rooftops, scattered debris — watch
content: A powerful tornado tore through Harris County, Texas, damaging over 100 homes on Monday afternoon. While no serious injuries or fatalities were reported, extensive destruction was evident, with rooftops torn off and debris scattered widely. Emergency crews are actively assessing the severe weather event's impact and ensuring resident safety.

title: 'Test cricket misses Kohli': Ex-RCB player's stinging post goes viral as India stare at another home series defeat
content: Former RCB player Shreevats Goswami believes India's Test team lacks Virat Kohli's infectious energy and belief, especially after another batting collapse against South Africa. Goswami argued Kohli's Test retirement was premature, stating the format misses his passion and the confidence he instilled. This sentiment resonates as Team India faces a potential home series loss, a stark contrast to Kohli's dominant era.

title: Million-dollar surprise: Brothers find Superman No. 1 in attic; comic sells for $9m
content: A forgotten comic book, discovered in a San Francisco attic, has shattered records, fetching a staggering $9.12 million. This pristine copy of "Superman No. 1," unearthed by three brothers, represents a remarkable find, highlighting the enduring value of rare collectibles and the unexpected ways family legacies can resurface. Its excellent condition and historical significance contributed to its record-breaking sale.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta suggests investors consider Bajaj Auto, L&T Finance, and Tech Mahindra for potential gains.  These stocks have shown positive technical indicators, including consolidation breakouts and moving average support, signaling an expected uptrend.

title: 'Makes no sense!' Shastri tears into Gautam Gambhir over team selection chaos
content: Ravi Shastri has strongly criticized India's batting approach and selection strategy in the second Test against South Africa. He questioned the decision to promote Washington Sundar to number three in the previous Test and then drop him to number eight in the current match, highlighting a lack of clarity in the team's planning.

title: Offset accused of plotting revenge on Stefon Diggs after leaked IG messages
content: Rapper Offset is accused by IG model Jordyn Gorr of attempting to "set up" NFL receiver Stefon Diggs due to alleged jealousy and a desire for payback. Gorr claims Offset pressured her for Diggs' location, which Offset's source denies, stating Gorr has a personal feud with the rapper. The situation intensifies with Cardi B's recent comments about Offset's private harassment.

title: Reckless! Rishabh Pant slammed for 'inexplicable' shot as India collapse in Guwahati
content: Rishabh Pant's aggressive approach backfired again in the second Test against South Africa, costing him his wicket for just 7 runs. Former selector Saba Karim criticized the captain's baffling decision-making, especially after tea when India desperately needed stability.  Pant's impulsive shot put the team in a precarious position, highlighting a lack of patience and judgment.

title: 'Silence with unbearable sound': Amitabh Bachchan mourns 'Sholay' co-star Dharmendra
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra, aged 89, passed away in Mumbai after a period of ill health. His final rites were attended by numerous industry stalwarts, including Amitabh Bachchan, who shared heartfelt tributes to the legendary star. Dharmendra's legacy, marked by his earthy charm and unwavering simplicity, was celebrated by colleagues and fans alike as the fraternity mourned his loss.

title: "Centuries-Old Wounds Healed": PM Modi Hoists Flag At Ayodhya Ram Temple
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday hoisted a saffron flag at Ayodhya's Ram Mandir during a sacred ceremony called "Dhwaj Arohan" and said that "wounds and pain of centuries are healing today".

title: Woman Loses Ornaments Worth Rs 50 Lakh In Robbery, Her Father Is A Suspect
content: A 70-year-old man, along with his daughter-in-law and her minor son, allegedly stole jewellery worth Rs 50 lakh from his own daughter's house after drugging her, police said on Tuesday.

title: New Labour Laws Likely To Generate 77 Lakh New Jobs: Report
content: The implementation of the government's new labour reforms could significantly boost employment and formalisation in India's labour market over the medium term, highlighted a report by the State Bank of India (SBI).

title: Indian Economy Likely Grew By 7.3% In July-September Quarter: Report
content: India'seconomy likely grew 7.3% in the JulySeptember quarter, according to a Reuters poll of economists, underpinned by strong rural and government expenditure even as private capital spending remained subdued.

title: Kerala Man Dies After Father Hits Him With Metal Rod Over Luxury Car Demand
content: A 28-year-old man, who had been under treatment after being fatally hit with a metal rod on his head by his father for demanding a luxury car, has died, police said on Tuesday.

title: France To Return 2 Pandas To China After 1 Suffers Kidney Failure
content: Two pandas at a zoo in central France are to return to China on Tuesday after the female was diagnosed with kidney failure, drawing hundreds of visitors for a final goodbye.

title: In Pics: The Ram Temple Sacred Flag PM Modi Will Hoist In Ayodhya
content: The saffron-coloured flag bears the image of a radiant sun, with an 'Om' inscribed on it along with the image of a Kovidara tree.

title: Bengaluru Techie Duped Of Rs 6.43 Lakh By Fake NRI Doctor On Matrimony App
content: A 34-year-old Bengaluru software engineer was cheated of Rs 6.43 lakh after she matched with a man pretending to be an NRI doctor on a matrimony app. What began as a friendly conversation quickly turned into a costly scam.

title: What Bengaluru Woman Injected By Husband With Mercury Said Before Death
content: According to Vidya's dying declaration, she faced continuous harassment, humiliation, and neglect from both her husband and father-in-law.

title: Bengaluru Doctor Duped Of Rs 2.7 Crore, Cops Probe Religious Body's Role
content: Police in Bengaluru are investigating a cheating case in which a doctor was reportedly duped of Rs 2.7 crore through a fraudulent land development scheme near the Kempegowda International Airport (KIA).

title: Cops Add 'National Security' Charge Over Maoist Slogans At Delhi Protest
content: The Delhi Police has invoked charges under 'imputations and assertions prejudicial to national integration' in one of the FIRs registered against a group of protesters who allegedly raised pro-Maoist slogans.

title: Hamas Attack Victims Sue Binance, Allege It Allowed Payments To Palestinian Group
content: More than 300 victims and family members of the Hamas attack sued Binance, co-founder Changpeng Zhao, and top executive Guangying Chen.

title: 'Told To Apply For Chinese Passport': Arunachal Woman On Airport Harassment
content: Prema Wangjom Thongdok has claimed she was detained in China during a transit at Shanghai Pudong Airport after immigration officials claimed her Indian passport was "invalid" because her listed birthplace, Arunachal Pradesh, was "not part of India".

title: Politics, Puran Poli And Humility Of Dharmendra
content: In the heart of Maharashtra, where the golden crust of 'puran poli' carries the fragrance of home and tradition, memories of Dharmendra linger - rich and timeless, much like the delicacy he adored.

title: Do Aliens Exist? India, Japan Team Up To Answer Question With Giant Telescope
content: The goal of the Thirty Metre Telescope project is to peer deeper into the cosmos than ever before, studying black holes, distant galaxies, and, most intriguingly, searching for signs of life beyond Earth.

title: Bharat Electronics, France's Safran To Build HAMMER Air-To-Surface Missiles
content: A major Indian defence public sector undertaking and a French firm on Monday joined hands for production of Highly Agile Modular Munition Extended Range (HAMMER) precision-guided weapon system in India, the defence ministry said.

title: Karnataka Lokayukta Conduct Raids At 8 Districts In Disproportionate Assets
content: Karnataka Lokayukta sleuths conducted raids at 10 locations across the state on Tuesday targeting government officers accused of amassing Disproportionate Assets to their known source of income.

title: Ethiopia Volcanic Eruption LIVE Updates: Ash Plumes Now Drifting Toward China, Says Weather Body
content: Ethiopia volcano eruption LIVE updates: The Hayli Gubbi volcano in Ethiopia's Afar region erupted on Sunday for the first time in nearly 12,000 years, sending thick ash plumes across the Red Sea toward Yemen and Oman.

content: new Orleans pelicans center Derik Queen faces the Atlanta Hawks again . the pair are rivals in the NBA, but some of that energy carries over when the two teams meet on the court . on the final drive, Falcons defensive tackle Ruke Orhoro sacked quarterback Tyler Shough .

title: Winners and losers: Gibbs notches highest score of season, Taylor goes quiet

title: France's 'Hammer' arms to be manufactured in India
content: the 'Hammer' smart precision guided air-to-ground weapons were used in the cross-border hostilities with Pakistan under Operation Sindoor in may . the weapons are designed to destroy bunkers and hardened shelters at ranges of around 70 km . indigenous Tejas jets are now being equipped with the weapons .

title: Need to strengthen free speech: CJI Surya Kant
content: justice Surya Kant takes oath as the 53rd CJI . he says freedom of speech is doubtless one of our most valued rights . his predecessor, ex-CJI B R Gavai, shared the view .

title: 'EWS' candidates take PG med courses with Rs 1 crore fees
content: almost 140 candidates from the economically weaker section have chosen postgraduate seats from management and NRI quotas of private medical colleges . tuition fees alone range from Rs 25 lakh to Rs 1 crore plus per year . this has raised questions about the credibility of EWS certificates .

title: 49ers top Panthers, as Christian McCaffrey beats former team
content: the 49ers beat the Carolina Panthers 20-9 in a game that figures to be pivotal in the NFC playoff chase . it happened again Monday night as the Niners overcame a litany of first-half mistakes to knock off a 49ers 20-9 . quarterback j'ayir brown provided the biggest slams for the Panthers .

title: Projecting the College Football Playoff top 12 after Week 13
content: the Sooners beat the Tigers 17-6 in Norman . there wasn't any movement in this week's top 12 projection . a dominant win against a now sub.-500 team isn't going to change the way the committee views Ohio State as the most complete team in the country .

title: Where the most chaos could be lurking on Rivalry Week
content: the penultimate week of the college football regular season gave us plenty of entertainment . we got an incredible comeback in Salt Lake City, we got some resounding blowouts and we got the best ending of the season at the Division II level . the ACC gave us more chaos thanks to Georgia Tech's no-show against Pitt .

title: 📈 CFB Power Rankings: Two new teams join
